definitions.definition: at a point within an area or a space

examples.text: The kids were playing in the street.
I read about it in the paper.

definitions.definition: within the shape of something; surrounded by something

examples.text: Leave the key in the lock.
He dipped his brush in the paint.
She got in her car and drove off.

definitions.definition: forming the whole or part of something/somebody; contained within something/somebody

examples.text: all the paintings in the collection
I recognize his father in him *(= his character is similar to his father's)*.
I'm getting forgetful in my old age.

definitions.definition: after a particular length of time

examples.text: to return in a few minutes/hours/days/months.
It will be ready in a week's time *(= one week from now)*.
She learnt to drive in three weeks *(= after three weeks she could drive)*.

definitions.definition: for a particular period of time

examples.text: I haven't seen him in years.
It's the first letter I've had in ten days.

definitions.definition: used to describe something that is all around you

examples.text: We went out in the rain.
He was sitting alone in the darkness.

definitions.definition: used to show the language, material, etc. used

examples.text: He spoke in a loud voice.

definitions.definition: used to show a state or condition

examples.text: The house is in good repair.
I must put my affairs in order.
The daffodils were in full bloom.

definitions.definition: involved in something; taking part in something
used to show somebody’s job or profession
used to show the form, shape, arrangement or quantity of something

examples.text: Roll it up in a ball.
People flocked in their thousands to see her.

definitions.definition: used to show the quality or thing that a judgement is being made about

examples.text: She was not lacking in courage.

definitions.definition: while doing something; while something is happening

examples.text: In attempting to save the child from drowning, she nearly lost her own life.
In all the commotion I forgot to tell him the news.

definitions.definition: used to introduce the name of a person who has a particular quality

examples.text: We're losing a first-rate editor in Jen.

definitions.definition: used to show a rate or relative amount

examples.text: a gradient of one in five
a tax rate of 22 pence in the pound
She was fortunate in that she had friends to help her.

wordOrigin: Old English in (preposition), inn, inne (adverb), of Germanic origin; related to Dutch and German in (preposition), German ein (adverb), from an Indo-European root shared by Latin in and Greek en.
